text.div:
HSPC Veteran Military Status

A set of codes that describe the individual's current military status

This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/patient-hspc-veteranMilitaryStatus defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
8ca8cc2b-baa0-4cb6-8863-418173c125d1 ReservesA part-time member of the armed forces (military) who maintains a long-term commitment to support their country if necessary.
4eb9a0a1-3334-48df-084d-cef37c9ac0d3 CivilianAn individual who is not a member of the armed forces (military).
70a68183-01a4-45b1-a5e6-49a13e221713 Family Member of Active DutyA family member of someone who has a full-time occupation in the armed forces (military).
189e9af6-bcbf-47e2-acee-4e5c50f54ba6 VeteranSomeone who has served or is currently serving in the armed forces (military).
bab7b911-e3cf-426f-95d6-0637d7091e07 Active Military DutyA full-time occupation as a member of the armed forces (military).
2b98cec8-b29d-4545-9350-a2b54dbd2fe7 Disabled VeteranA member of the armed forces (military) who became disabled while carrying out their duties.
617936ec-d6a7-4642-a1d8-b27bf8735f9d Family Member of Retired MilitaryA family member of someone who has retired from the armed forces (military).
40d86a62-67a9-49c6-8f43-c1a9ef51689b Inactive Ready ReserveA previous full-time member of the armed forces (military) who has a commitment to be called to active duty if necessary, but who currently works as a civilian.
ca02026a-3ebf-4fb4-09e0-02d89c931643 Retired militaryRetired from a career in the armed forces (military).
75f4440a-ec37-47fe-b26d-39c09c204676 National GuardA part-time member of a reserve military force of the United States military whos units are composed of members from the state or territory of residence.

name: HSPC Veteran Military Status
description: A set of codes that describe the individual's current military status

concept.definition: A part-time member of the armed forces (military) who maintains a long-term commitment to support their country if necessary.
An individual who is not a member of the armed forces (military).
A family member of someone who has a full-time occupation in the armed forces (military).
Someone who has served or is currently serving in the armed forces (military).
A full-time occupation as a member of the armed forces (military).
A member of the armed forces (military) who became disabled while carrying out their duties.
A family member of someone who has retired from the armed forces (military).
A previous full-time member of the armed forces (military) who has a commitment to be called to active duty if necessary, but who currently works as a civilian.
Retired from a career in the armed forces (military).
A part-time member of a reserve military force of the United States military whos units are composed of members from the state or territory of residence.
